creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: two-panel folding screen; thin, stylized red, gold, silver, and burgundy bamboo stalks against black background; small spray of bamboo foliage on L screen
marks: Signature back of R panel, LLC: [晃仙] [Kōsen]
medium: Black and colored lacquer, gold and silver powder, and mother-of-pearl inlay on wood
text: Low folding screens such as this were originally used to block the heat of the portable brazier (furo), used to prepare water for tea, from participants to a tea gathering during the warm months of the summer. Such screens later became largely decorative. This modern furosaki features a bamboo design in colored lacquer, with gold and silver maki-e and strips of mother-of-pearl inlays, which pop against the glossy roiro background.
title: Bamboo
